intro: Ptilotus gaudichaudii subsp. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy soils. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. This subspecies is notable for its resilience and is often found in coastal and inland dunes.
